key_points: Kyle Rittenhouse expressed in hindsight that going to Kenosha, Wisconsin, may not have been the best idea.
Rittenhouse discussed the matter on the podcast 'You Are Here', hosted by BlazeTV.
He stated, despite regrets, he defended himself during the events in Kenosha.
Rittenhouse was acquitted last month of all charges related to shooting two men dead and wounding another during protests.
His defense argued the shootings were in self-defense and he aimed to provide medical care and protect businesses.
Prosecutors contended Rittenhouse escalated the situation by arming himself with an AR-15 style weapon.
Co-host Sydney Watson made controversial remarks about the shootings, which Rittenhouse did not celebrate.
The families of the victims expressed their dismay at the verdict, highlighting a lack of accountability.
Rittenhouse mentioned suffering from PTSD but tries to cope through humor, discussing trial memes.
He denies being a hero, insisting he only defended himself.
